english_definition: To reduce in intensity, amount, or degree; to lessen or diminish.

english_definition: To shorten a word, phrase, or text.
example_sentence: You can abbreviate 'Doctor' as 'Dr.'
korean_translation: 당신은 'Doctor'를 'Dr.'로 줄일 수 있습니다.

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: The part of the body between the chest and the pelvis containing the stomach and other organs.

GMAT_score: Low relevance

english_definition: To officially end or stop something, especially a law or system.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for reading comprehension questions.

english_definition: to be plentiful, to exist in large numbers or amounts

english_definition: to shorten or condense a text, speech, or other piece of information

english_definition: Complete and total; not dependent on anything else.

english_definition: to take in or soak up (energy, liquid, information, etc.)

english_definition: To voluntarily refrain from doing something

GMAT_score: Low relevance, mostly used in abstract or philosophical contexts

english_definition: related to education, scholarship, or learning

GMAT_score: Relevant in analytical writing or argument reasoning sections.

english_definition: Able to be reached, entered, or used.

english_definition: happening by chance or unintentionally

english_definition: To gather or pile up something, especially over time.

english_definition: highly skilled or proficient at something

english_definition: skillful and clever in handling situations or tasks

korean_translation: 그 호텔은 수영장과 무료 와이파이 같은 많은 편의 시설을 제공합니다.

english_definition: harmful or unfavorable

english_definition: To promote a product, service, or idea by publicizing it.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for Verbal section.

english_definition: more than enough; abundant; spacious

english_definition: A person who publicly supports a particular cause, policy, or idea, or to support something publicly

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and critical reasoning sections

english_definition: to increase the strength or amount of something, especially sound or energy
example_sentence: The speaker was used to amplify the sound during the concert.
korean_translation: 스피커는 콘서트 중에 소리를 증폭하기 위해 사용되었다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily useful in reading comprehension or analytical writing.

english_definition: relating to the air or atmosphere; existing above the ground
example_sentence: The aerial view of the city was breathtaking.

GMAT_score: Low relevance for business-related contexts

english_definition: similar in some way; comparable

english_definition: Relating to or involving oxygen, especially in the process of aerobic exercise.
example_sentence: Aerobic exercise improves cardiovascular health.

IELTS_score: Moderately Relevant
GMAT_score: Minimally Relevant

korean_definition: 분석하다, 어떤 대상을 세밀히 조사하여 그 속성을 알아내다
english_definition: To examine methodically and in detail the constitution or structure of something, typically for purposes of explanation and interpretation
example_sentence: The scientist will analyze the data to find patterns.
korean_translation: 과학자는 데이터를 분석하여 패턴을 찾을 것이다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for academic writing and speaking
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing and reasoning sections

english_definition: Related to beauty or the appreciation of artistic qualities
example_sentence: The aesthetic design of the building attracts many tourists.
korean_translation: 그 건물의 미적인 디자인은 많은 관광객들을 끌어들인다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, especially in analytical writing

english_definition: A person from whom one is descended, typically one more remote than a grandparent.
example_sentence: Our ancestors lived in small villages and farmed the land.
korean_translation: 우리 조상들은 작은 마을에 살며 땅을 경작했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in reading and writing sections, especially in topics related to history or heritage.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in analytical writing and reading comprehension sections.

english_definition: friendly, good-natured, or easy to talk to
example_sentence: The manager was affable and made everyone feel comfortable during the meeting.
korean_translation: 매니저는 상냥하여 회의 중 모두가 편안함을 느끼게 했다.

korean_definition: 짧고 재미있는 이야기 또는 개인적인 일화
english_definition: A short and amusing or interesting story about a real incident or person
example_sentence: She shared an amusing anecdote about her trip to Italy last summer.
korean_translation: 그녀는 지난 여름 이탈리아 여행에 대한 재미있는 일화를 공유했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance

english_definition: To produce an effect or change in something or someone
example_sentence: The new policy will affect the economy significantly.
korean_translation: 새로운 정책은 경제에 상당한 영향을 미칠 것이다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in writing and speaking sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in analytical writing and reading comprehension sections

korean_definition: 의식과 통증을 느끼지 못하도록 만드는 상태 또는 방법
english_definition: A state or method of causing insensitivity to pain or consciousness.
example_sentence: The patient was given anesthesia before the surgery.
korean_translation: 환자는 수술 전에 마취를 받았다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance

english_definition: to officially attach or connect a subsidiary group or a person to an organization
example_sentence: The company decided to affiliate with a larger corporation to expand its market reach.
korean_translation: 그 회사는 시장 범위를 확장하기 위해 더 큰 기업과 제휴하기로 결정했다.

english_definition: A strong feeling of hostility or opposition.
example_sentence: There was obvious animosity between the two coworkers.
korean_translation: 두 동료 사이에는 분명한 적대감이 있었다.

korean_definition: 친밀감, 친근감; 어떤 것에 대한 선호나 끌림
english_definition: A natural liking for or attraction to someone or something.
example_sentence: She felt an immediate affinity for the people she met during her travels.
korean_translation: 그녀는 여행 중 만난 사람들에게 즉각적인 친밀감을 느꼈다.

english_definition: To destroy completely or obliterate
example_sentence: The invading army aimed to annihilate the entire city.
korean_translation: 침략군은 도시 전체를 전멸시키는 것을 목표로 했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance for business context

english_definition: having a great deal of money; wealthy
example_sentence: The affluent neighborhood was filled with luxurious houses and expensive cars.
korean_translation: 그 부유한 동네는 호화로운 집들과 비싼 차들로 가득 차 있었다.

english_definition: something that deviates from the norm or expectation
example_sentence: The scientist discovered an anomaly in the data that required further investigation.
korean_translation: 과학자는 추가적인 조사가 필요한 데이터에서 특이점을 발견했다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analyzing data discrepancies or exceptions.

english_definition: The consequences or results following an event, especially a disastrous one
example_sentence: The aftermath of the storm left the town in ruins.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension passages

english_definition: Without revealing one's identity; in a way that does not disclose who someone is.

korean_translation: 그녀는 익명으로 자선단체에 많은 금액을 기부했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, occasionally encountered in Reading Comprehension passages.

korean_definition: 대리, 대행 또는 특정한 일을 수행하는 조직
english_definition: An organization or entity that acts on behalf of others or conducts specific tasks
example_sentence: The advertising agency created a successful campaign for their client.
korean_translation: 광고 대행사는 고객을 위한 성공적인 캠페인을 만들었다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in reading and writing sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in verbal and analytical writing sections

korean_definition: 세균이나 기타 미생물의 성장을 억제하거나 파괴하는 물질

example_sentence: The doctor prescribed an antibiotic to treat the infection.

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: To make worse or more severe; to annoy or irritate.
example_sentence: The loud music aggravated her headache.

IELTS_score: Moderately relevant in context of describing worsening situations.
GMAT_score: Low relevance; primarily used in argumentative or descriptive scenarios.

korean_definition: 항체는 면역 체계를 구성하는 단백질로, 신체에 침입한 병원체를 인식하고 제거하는 역할을 한다.
english_definition: An antibody is a protein produced by the immune system to identify and neutralize pathogens like bacteria and viruses.
example_sentence: The presence of antibodies in the blood indicates a response to infection.
korean_translation: 혈액 내 항체의 존재는 감염에 대한 반응을 나타낸다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in medical-related topics and scientific vocabulary.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily used in scientific contexts rather than business or analytical reasoning.

english_definition: To collect or gather into a whole; a whole formed by combining several elements.
example_sentence: The company aims to aggregate data from various sources to improve its services.
korean_translation: 그 회사는 서비스를 개선하기 위해 다양한 출처에서 데이터를 모으는 것을 목표로 하고 있다.

english_definition: To expect or predict something in advance
example_sentence: She anticipated the problems before they arose.
korean_translation: 그녀는 문제가 발생하기 전에 그것을 예상했다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing and critical reasoning sections

english_definition: relating to farming or agricultural practices
example_sentence: The agricultural sector plays a vital role in the country's economy.
korean_translation: 농업 부문은 국가 경제에서 중요한 역할을 한다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, occasionally encountered in reading comprehension or critical reasoning passages

korean_definition: 항원은 면역 반응을 유발하는 외부 물질이다.
english_definition: An antigen is a substance that induces an immune response in the body, especially the production of antibodies.
example_sentence: The immune system produces antibodies in response to the presence of an antigen.
korean_translation: 면역 체계는 항원이 존재할 때 항체를 생성한다.
IELTS_score: 6.5 - 7.5 in reading, related to biology or health topics
GMAT_score: Low relevance, mainly appears in scientific context questions

english_definition: to point or direct at a target; a goal or purpose
example_sentence: She aimed to finish the project by next week.
korean_translation: 그녀는 다음 주까지 프로젝트를 끝내는 것을 목표로 삼았다.

korean_definition: 산화 방지제, 신체의 산화를 방지하는 물질
english_definition: A substance that prevents or slows down the oxidation process in the body.
example_sentence: Eating fruits rich in antioxidants can help protect your cells from damage.
korean_translation: 항산화제가 풍부한 과일을 먹으면 세포 손상을 방지하는 데 도움을 줄 수 있습니다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance in business contexts

english_definition: Carried or transported by the air; in the air.
example_sentence: The pollen became airborne, causing allergies for many people.

GMAT_score: Low relevance unless related to specific scenarios in reading comprehension

korean_definition: 오래되어 가치가 있는 골동품 또는 고풍스러운 물건
english_definition: An object that is old and has historical or artistic value
example_sentence: She bought an antique clock at the flea market.
korean_translation: 그녀는 벼룩시장에서 골동품 시계를 샀다.

GMAT_score: Low

korean_definition: 선천적으로 멜라닌 색소가 부족하여 피부, 머리카락, 눈 등이 흰색 또는 연한 색을 띠는 사람
english_definition: A person or animal born with a lack of melanin pigment, resulting in white or pale skin, hair, and eyes.
example_sentence: The albino rabbit stood out among the others with its pure white fur and red eyes.
korean_translation: 그 알비노 토끼는 순백의 털과 빨간 눈으로 다른 토끼들 사이에서 두드러졌다.

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: Being watchful and ready to respond to danger or emergencies.
example_sentence: The security guards remained alert throughout the night.

GMAT_score: Low

korean_definition: 소독제, 살균제 또는 살균 효과가 있는
english_definition: A substance that prevents the growth of disease-causing microorganisms, or relating to sterilization.
example_sentence: The nurse cleaned the wound with an antiseptic solution.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily useful for general vocabulary enrichment.

english_definition: A step-by-step procedure or set of rules for solving a problem or completing a task
example_sentence: The algorithm efficiently sorted the data in ascending order.

IELTS_score: High relevance for academic purposes in technology-related topics
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in problem-solving and logical reasoning sections

english_definition: Feeling worried, nervous, or uneasy about something with an uncertain outcome

korean_translation: 그녀는 중요한 발표 전에 불안감을 느꼈다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension or critical reasoning

korean_definition: 기구, 장치 또는 특정 목적을 수행하는 데 필요한 조직이나 구조
english_definition: A complex structure or mechanism used for a specific purpose, or a system of organization
example_sentence: The laboratory was equipped with sophisticated scientific apparatus.
korean_translation: 그 실험실은 정교한 과학 기구로 장비되어 있었다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance; rarely used in business contexts

korean_definition: 불안, 고통, 걱정 등을 완화하다, 줄이다

korean_translation: 정부는 새로운 정책에 대한 대중의 두려움을 완화하기 위한 조치를 취했다.

english_definition: A request for help or support; the quality of being attractive or interesting.
example_sentence: The charity made an appeal for donations to support their cause.
korean_translation: 그 자선 단체는 그들의 목적을 지원하기 위해 기부를 요청했다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and argument analysis sections.

english_definition: According to what is claimed or reported, but without proof.
example_sentence: The suspect allegedly stole the money from the store.
korean_translation: 용의자가 가게에서 돈을 훔쳤다는 주장이 있다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance; rarely used in business or analytical contexts.

korean_definition: 추상적인 개념이나 도덕적 메시지를 상징적으로 표현하는 이야기나 그림
english_definition: A story, poem, or picture that can be interpreted to reveal a hidden meaning, typically a moral or political one
example_sentence: The novel is an allegory of the struggle between good and evil.
korean_translation: 그 소설은 선과 악의 싸움을 상징적으로 표현한 우화이다.

english_definition: A thing that is attached to something larger or more important, typically as a supplementary part.
example_sentence: The insect's appendage was used for grasping and holding onto surfaces.
korean_translation: 그 곤충의 부속 기관은 표면을 잡거나 고정하는 데 사용되었다.
IELTS_score: Low
GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: A section or table added at the end of a book; or a tube-shaped sac attached to the lower end of the large intestine.
example_sentence: The appendix at the end of the book provides additional resources.
korean_translation: 책 마지막의 부록은 추가 자료를 제공합니다.
IELTS_score: Medium
GMAT_score: Low

korean_definition: 식욕, 무언가를 하고자 하는 강렬한 욕구
english_definition: a natural desire to eat or a strong desire for something
example_sentence: She has lost her appetite after hearing the bad news.
korean_translation: 그녀는 나쁜 소식을 들은 후 식욕을 잃었다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance for topics related to health, food, or lifestyle.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, might appear in reading comprehension or analogies.

english_definition: The act of clapping to show approval or enjoyment.
example_sentence: The audience broke into applause after the performance.
korean_translation: 공연 후 관객들이 박수를 치기 시작했다.

english_definition: to officially choose someone for a job or position
example_sentence: The committee decided to appoint a new manager for the project.
korean_translation: 위원회는 프로젝트를 위한 새로운 매니저를 임명하기로 결정했다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance for topics like business and leadership.
GMAT_score: High relevance in context of management and organizational scenarios.

english_definition: To recognize the value or importance of something; to be grateful for something.
example_sentence: I truly appreciate your help with the project.
korean_translation: 저는 프로젝트를 도와주신 것에 진심으로 감사드립니다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and analytical writing.

english_definition: A person who is learning a trade or skill from a skilled employer, typically for a fixed period.
example_sentence: The young apprentice worked diligently under the guidance of the master carpenter.
korean_translation: 젊은 견습생은 목수 스승의 지도 아래 성실히 일했다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance for vocabulary related to work and education contexts.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, occasionally seen in reading comprehension passages.

english_definition: The action or process of officially agreeing to something or accepting it as satisfactory.
example_sentence: The manager gave her approval for the new project.
korean_translation: 매니저는 새로운 프로젝트에 대해 승인을 내렸다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in writing and speaking sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in verbal reasoning and critical analysis tasks.

korean_definition: 적성, 소질, 재능을 의미하며 특정 분야에서 능력이나 재능을 발휘할 수 있는 자연적인 능력
english_definition: A natural ability or talent to do something, often in a specific field or skill
example_sentence: Her aptitude for mathematics was evident from a very young age.
korean_translation: 그녀의 수학에 대한 적성은 어린 시절부터 분명히 드러났다.
IELTS_score: High relevance, often used in academic and skill-related contexts
GMAT_score: Medium relevance, commonly associated with logical and analytical skill assessments

english_definition: Relating to water; living or occurring in water.
example_sentence: Many aquatic animals are adapted to live in salty environments.
korean_translation: 많은 수중 동물들은 소금기가 있는 환경에서 살도록 적응되어 있다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance for environmental topics.
GMAT_score: Low relevance for test vocabulary.

korean_definition: 지하수층, 물을 저장하고 전달할 수 있는 지하의 암석층 또는 토양층
english_definition: A body of permeable rock or sediment that stores groundwater and allows the flow of water through it.
example_sentence: The city relies on the aquifer for its drinking water supply.
korean_translation: 그 도시는 식수 공급을 위해 지하수층에 의존한다.
synonyms: water table, groundwater reservoir, subsurface water

korean_definition: 임의의, 자의적인. 특별한 이유나 기준 없이 결정된 것을 의미함.
english_definition: Based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system.
example_sentence: The decision to cancel the meeting was entirely arbitrary.
korean_translation: 회의를 취소하기로 한 결정은 완전히 임의적이었다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance, often used in academic contexts.
GMAT_score: High relevance, frequently used in critical reasoning sections.

english_definition: Relating to trees or living in trees
example_sentence: Many primates are arboreal, spending most of their time in trees.
korean_translation: 많은 영장류는 나무에서 대부분의 시간을 보내는 수목 생활을 한다.
IELTS_score: Medium
GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: Very old or old-fashioned; no longer in common use
example_sentence: The archaic language in the ancient manuscript was difficult to understand.
korean_translation: 고대 원고에 사용된 오래된 언어는 이해하기 어려웠다.
IELTS_score: Medium
GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: a very typical example of a certain person or thing; an original model or pattern
example_sentence: The hero in the story is an archetype of bravery and selflessness.
korean_translation: 이 이야기 속의 영웅은 용기와 이타심의 원형이다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for understanding literary texts or advanced vocabulary
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analyzing patterns in arguments or examples

korean_definition: 문서나 데이터를 보관하는 장소 또는 시스템
english_definition: A place or system for storing documents or data
example_sentence: The library has a digital archive of historical manuscripts.
korean_translation: 도서관에는 역사적 원고의 디지털 보관소가 있다.

korean_translation: 그녀는 신중히 예산을 계획하여 금융 위기를 방지할 수 있었다.

english_definition: Showing great enthusiasm or interest
example_sentence: She is an avid reader of science fiction novels.
korean_translation: 그녀는 과학 소설의 열렬한 독자이다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for describing personal interests and hobbies.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for verbal reasoning and business-related contexts.

english_definition: To rouse from sleep or make someone aware of something
example_sentence: The sound of the thunder awakened her in the middle of the night.
korean_translation: 천둥소리가 그녀를 한밤중에 깨웠다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for writing and reading sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for critical reasoning

korean_definition: 축, 중심선 또는 기준이 되는 선
english_definition: A straight line around which an object rotates or a reference line for measurement
example_sentence: The Earth rotates around its axis once every 24 hours.
korean_translation: 지구는 24시간마다 축을 중심으로 회전합니다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily used in quantitative geometry questions

english_definition: to talk rapidly and continuously in a foolish or incomprehensible manner

korean_translation: 그 아이는 자신의 좋아하는 장난감들에 대해 지껄이기 시작했다.

korean_definition: 보석금; 보석금을 내고 석방시키다; (특히 어려운 상황에서) 포기하다
english_definition: money paid to release someone from jail; to secure someone's release; to abandon or give up (especially in difficult situations)
example_sentence: He decided to bail on the project when it became too complicated.
korean_translation: 그는 프로젝트가 너무 복잡해지자 포기하기로 결정했다.

english_definition: having all elements in proper proportion or harmony
example_sentence: She maintains a balanced diet to stay healthy.

IELTS_score: high relevance for writing and speaking tasks
GMAT_score: moderate relevance for analytical writing

english_definition: A process of voting, usually in written form; a piece of paper used for voting.
example_sentence: Each voter cast their ballot in the election.
korean_translation: 각 유권자는 선거에서 투표를 했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in topics related to democracy and elections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in arguments or discussions about decision-making processes.

korean_definition: 진정제나 위안을 주는 물질, 특히 피부를 진정시키는 크림이나 약
english_definition: A soothing ointment or substance, especially one used to heal or comfort the skin.
example_sentence: The balm helped soothe her sunburned skin.

GMAT_score: Low relevance

korean_definition: 금지하다, 법적으로 또는 공식적으로 어떤 행동을 못하도록 막다
english_definition: To officially or legally prohibit something

korean_translation: 정부는 공공장소에서의 흡연을 금지하기로 결정했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for topics related to law and ethics
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for topics related to regulations and policies

english_definition: to expel or send away, especially as a form of punishment.
example_sentence: The king decided to banish the traitor from the kingdom.
korean_translation: 왕은 배신자를 왕국에서 추방하기로 결정했다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance in writing and speaking sections
GMAT_score: Low relevance

korean_definition: 세례를 베풀다; 특정 이름이나 별명을 붙이다
english_definition: to perform the ceremony of baptism; to give a name or nickname to someone
example_sentence: The priest will baptize the child in the church this Sunday.

GMAT_score: Low relevance

english_definition: To make a loud, sharp sound (as a dog); the outer covering of a tree.
example_sentence: The dog began to bark loudly at the stranger.

GMAT_score: Low relevance for verbal section

english_definition: A structure or object that prevents movement or access, or something that obstructs progress.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, may appear in reading comprehension or logical reasoning sections.

korean_definition: 물물교환하다; 물건이나 서비스를 돈 없이 교환하는 행위
english_definition: to exchange goods or services without using money
example_sentence: They decided to barter their handmade crafts for fresh produce.

GMAT_score: Low relevance as a business term

english_definition: The underlying support or foundation for an idea, argument, or process.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing

english_definition: An advantage, profit, or helpful effect
example_sentence: Regular exercise has numerous health benefits.
korean_translation: 규칙적인 운동은 건강에 많은 이점을 제공합니다.
IELTS_score: High
GMAT_score: Medium

english_definition: Well-meaning and kindly; characterized by a desire to help others or promote their welfare.
example_sentence: She was known for her benevolent actions towards the poor and needy in her community.
korean_translation: 그녀는 지역 사회의 가난하고 힘든 사람들을 향한 자비로운 행동으로 유명했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance, often used in reading and writing sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, useful for comprehension and essay writing.

english_definition: To give or present something as a gift or honor.
example_sentence: The queen decided to bestow the title of knight upon the brave soldier.
korean_translation: 여왕은 용감한 병사에게 기사 작위를 수여하기로 결정했다.

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: Having or showing an unreasonable preference or prejudice towards one side or viewpoint.
example_sentence: The article was clearly biased against the new policy.
korean_translation: 그 기사는 명백히 새로운 정책에 반대하는 편향성을 가지고 있었다.

GMAT_score: Frequently relevant in critical reasoning and analytical writing sections.

english_definition: to argue about petty or trivial matters
example_sentence: The siblings would often bicker over who got to sit in the front seat.
korean_translation: 형제자매는 누가 앞자리에 앉을지에 대해 자주 말다툼을 하곤 했다.

english_definition: A statement of charges or a proposed law presented for approval

korean_translation: 식사 후 식당이 그에게 계산서를 건넸다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for business and legal contexts

english_definition: To tie or fasten something; to cause someone to be in a difficult situation

GMAT_score: Low relevance

korean_definition: 묶는 것 또는 연결하는 것, 특히 물리적이거나 법적인 구속

example_sentence: The contract is legally binding for both parties.

GMAT_score: High relevance, frequently appears in business and legal-related reading passages

GMAT_score: Less relevant but could appear in Reading Comprehension passages related to sustainability.

example_sentence: Biodiversity is essential for maintaining ecological balance and supporting life on Earth.

IELTS_score: High relevance in environmental topics and ecology sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and analytical writing.

example_sentence: The tundra biome is known for its cold climate and sparse vegetation.

GMAT_score: Low relevance unless in scientific passages

example_sentence: Humans are the most advanced bipeds on Earth.

GMAT_score: Low

korean_definition: 협박이나 위협을 사용하여 금품이나 이익을 강제로 요구하는 행위

GMAT_score: Low relevance in verbal and analytical sections

english_definition: the act of insulting or showing contempt for something sacred

GMAT_score: Low relevance in business contexts.

english_definition: Lacking warmth, life, or hope; dreary or desolate.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily used in descriptive contexts.

example_sentence: The blizzard caused all flights to be canceled.

english_definition: To produce flowers; to flourish or develop in a promising way

english_definition: A detailed plan or design that explains how something is to be built or achieved.

english_definition: Not clear or sharp; lacking definition or focus

GMAT_score: Low relevance as it is not commonly used in GMAT contexts

english_definition: A wetland area, often covered in moss and water.

GMAT_score: Not Applicable

english_definition: not genuine or real; fake or counterfeit

korean_translation: 그 회사는 고객들에게 가짜 제품을 판매한 혐의를 받았다.

english_definition: to increase, improve, or support something
example_sentence: The new marketing strategy helped boost sales significantly.
korean_translation: 새로운 마케팅 전략은 매출을 상당히 증대시키는 데 도움을 주었다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing and business context

english_definition: To make someone feel weary or uninterested; to drill a hole

GMAT_score: Low relevance but could appear in reading comprehension

english_definition: a large rock, typically one that has been worn smooth by erosion
example_sentence: The hiker sat on a boulder to rest and enjoy the view.

GMAT_score: Low relevance

english_definition: An act of breaking or failing to observe a law, agreement, or code of conduct; a gap in a wall, barrier, or defense.

korean_translation: 그 회사는 데이터 보안 규정을 위반하여 벌금을 부과받았다.

english_definition: A significant discovery or achievement that overcomes an obstacle or leads to progress.
example_sentence: The scientist's breakthrough in cancer research has given hope to many patients.
korean_translation: 그 과학자의 암 연구 돌파구는 많은 환자들에게 희망을 주었다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, mostly appears in Reading Comprehension passages.

english_definition: to take air into the lungs and then expel it, especially as a regular physiological process

GMAT_score: Low relevance; may appear in reading comprehension passages

korean_definition: 숨이 멎을 정도로 놀라운 또는 아름다운
english_definition: Extremely exciting, impressive, or beautiful
example_sentence: The view from the mountain was absolutely breathtaking.

GMAT_score: Low relevance

english_definition: To produce offspring, typically through reproduction; to raise animals or plants.

korean_translation: 농부들은 종종 우유와 고기 생산을 위해 소를 번식시킨다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance unless used in metaphorical or business contexts.

english_definition: a light wind or a gentle movement of air

korean_translation: 산들바람이 정원에 있는 꽃들을 부드럽게 흔들었다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, rarely used in problem-solving or analytical contexts.

english_definition: The act of offering, giving, receiving, or soliciting something of value as a means of influencing the actions of an individual holding a public or legal duty.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in business ethics scenarios

english_definition: To react angrily or defensively; to have stiff hairs stand on end

GMAT_score: Low relevance for verbal reasoning but useful in analytical writing.

english_definition: relating to or affecting the bronchi, the major air passages of the lungs.
example_sentence: The patient was diagnosed with a bronchial infection.
korean_translation: 환자는 기관지 감염으로 진단받았다.

english_definition: abrupt or curt in manner or speech, often to the point of rudeness
example_sentence: She gave a brusque reply when asked about her plans.
korean_translation: 그녀는 자신의 계획에 대해 물었을 때 퉁명스러운 대답을 했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance but useful in reading comprehension

english_definition: a small protuberance on a plant that develops into a leaf, flower, or shoot

korean_translation: 장미 덤불이 이른 봄에 싹트기 시작했다.

english_definition: Able to float easily; cheerful and optimistic
example_sentence: The buoyant mood of the team boosted their performance.
korean_translation: 팀의 밝은 분위기는 그들의 성과를 향상시켰다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance for analytical writing and reasoning sections

english_definition: beginning to grow or increase rapidly; flourishing
example_sentence: The burgeoning tech industry is attracting investors from all over the world.

IELTS_score: High relevance in topics related to business and technology.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, often used in business contexts.

english_definition: The act or process of placing a dead body into the ground or a tomb.
example_sentence: The burial ceremony was held in the churchyard.

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: To restrict or keep within limits; to enclose or imprison.

korean_definition: 강이나 물줄기가 바다나 호수로 흘러들어가는 입구에서 퇴적물로 인해 형성된 삼각형 모양의 지형
english_definition: A triangular-shaped landform created at the mouth of a river where it deposits sediment as it flows into a larger body of water like a sea or lake
example_sentence: The Nile River delta is one of the most fertile regions in the world.

korean_definition: 비현실적이고 잘못된 믿음을 가진 상태를 묘사하는 형용사
english_definition: Having false or unrealistic beliefs or opinions, often despite evidence to the contrary
example_sentence: She was delusional, believing she could become a famous singer despite having no musical talent.
korean_translation: 그녀는 자신에게 음악적 재능이 전혀 없는데도 유명 가수가 될 수 있다고 믿으며 망상적이었다.

english_definition: A strong request or need for something
example_sentence: The demand for electric cars is increasing rapidly.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, often appears in business-related contexts.

korean_definition: 인구 통계와 관련된, 특정 집단의 인구학적 특성
english_definition: Relating to the statistical characteristics of populations, such as age, race, or income.
example_sentence: The company conducted a demographic survey to better understand its target audience.
korean_translation: 회사는 목표 고객층을 더 잘 이해하기 위해 인구 통계 조사를 실시했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for academic writing and reading sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for business-related passages and data interpretation.

english_definition: To destroy or tear down completely
example_sentence: The old building was demolished to make room for a new park.
korean_translation: 그 오래된 건물은 새로운 공원을 만들기 위해 철거되었다.

english_definition: to show clearly, explain or prove something by giving examples or evidence
example_sentence: The scientist demonstrated the process of photosynthesis to the students.
korean_translation: 과학자는 학생들에게 광합성 과정을 시연해 보였다.
IELTS_score: High relevance, commonly used in speaking and writing tasks
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, frequently appears in verbal reasoning

korean_definition: 단백질이나 화합물이 원래의 성질을 잃고 변형되다.
english_definition: To alter the natural qualities of something, often referring to proteins or substances losing their original properties.
example_sentence: The high temperature caused the proteins in the egg to denature.
korean_translation: 높은 온도가 계란 속 단백질의 성질을 변형시켰다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance in scientific or technical contexts.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, rarely used in business or analytical reasoning.

english_definition: the action of refusing to accept or acknowledge something
example_sentence: Her denial of the situation only made things worse.
korean_translation: 그녀의 상황 부정은 상황을 더 악화시켰다.

english_definition: to represent or indicate something
example_sentence: The red color on the map denotes danger zones.
korean_translation: 지도에 있는 빨간색은 위험 지역을 나타낸다.

english_definition: Closely compacted in substance; having high density.
example_sentence: The forest was so dense that sunlight barely reached the ground.
korean_translation: 숲이 너무 빽빽해서 햇빛이 거의 바닥에 닿지 않았다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and analytical writing.

english_definition: To represent or describe something in words or images.
example_sentence: The artist was asked to depict the beauty of the natural landscape.
korean_translation: 그 예술가는 자연 풍경의 아름다움을 묘사해 달라는 요청을 받았다.

english_definition: The reduction or exhaustion of resources, energy, or supply.
example_sentence: The depletion of natural resources is a growing concern for environmentalists.

IELTS_score: High relevance in environmental and resource-related essays.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in business and economics contexts.

english_definition: to expel a foreigner from a country, typically on the grounds of illegal status or for having committed a crime
example_sentence: The government decided to deport the undocumented immigrant.
korean_translation: 정부는 불법 체류자를 추방하기로 결정했다.

korean_definition: 무언가를 특정 장소에 놓거나 맡기는 행위, 또는 은행 계좌에 돈을 예치하는 것
english_definition: The act of placing something in a specific location or depositing money into a bank account
example_sentence: She decided to deposit $500 into her savings account.
korean_translation: 그녀는 저축 계좌에 500달러를 예금하기로 결정했다.

english_definition: To reduce the value or price of something; to belittle or undervalue.
example_sentence: The value of the car depreciates rapidly after purchase.
korean_translation: 자동차의 가치는 구매 후 빠르게 감소한다.

english_definition: Feeling sad, dejected, or in low spirits.
example_sentence: She felt depressed after losing her job.
korean_translation: 그녀는 직장을 잃고 나서 우울함을 느꼈다.

english_definition: to take something away from someone, especially something necessary or enjoyable
example_sentence: The new policy will deprive many people of their basic rights.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for critical reasoning and verbal sections

korean_definition: 대리인, 부대표, 또는 직무를 대신 수행하는 사람
english_definition: A person appointed or empowered to act on behalf of someone else; a second-in-command.
example_sentence: The deputy was responsible for managing the office in the absence of the director.
korean_translation: 부대표는 감독이 부재 중일 때 사무실을 관리할 책임이 있었다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, might appear in reading comprehension or business contexts

english_definition: To obtain something from a specific source or to originate from something

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in verbal reasoning

english_definition: a person, plant, or animal that is descended from a particular ancestor
example_sentence: She is a direct descendant of Queen Victoria.
korean_translation: 그녀는 빅토리아 여왕의 직계 후손이다.

english_definition: the act of moving downwards or ancestry/origin
example_sentence: The airplane began its descent toward the airport.
korean_translation: 비행기가 공항을 향해 하강하기 시작했다.

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: Providing details or describing characteristics.
example_sentence: The author used descriptive language to paint a vivid picture of the scene.
korean_translation: 저자는 생생한 장면을 묘사하기 위해 묘사적인 언어를 사용했다.

english_definition: Empty and abandoned, without inhabitants.
example_sentence: The village looked completely deserted after the storm.

GMAT_score: Low relevance in typical GMAT contexts.

example_sentence: Desertification is threatening many regions around the world due to climate change and unsustainable farming practices.
korean_translation: 사막화는 기후 변화와 지속 불가능한 농업 관행으로 인해 전 세계 여러 지역을 위협하고 있습니다.
synonyms: land degradation, soil erosion, drought-induced aridity

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in analytical writing and reading comprehension

english_definition: to be worthy of or suitable for something, especially a reward or punishment

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension

korean_translation: 황량한 풍경이 나무 하나, 집 하나 없이 수 마일에 걸쳐 펼쳐져 있었다.

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: To regard with contempt or a lack of respect; to dislike strongly.
example_sentence: She despises people who are dishonest.

GMAT_score: Low relevance in verbal reasoning

example_sentence: She succeeded despite the challenges she faced.

english_definition: lacking resources or possessions, especially the necessities of life

GMAT_score: Low

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for verbal reasoning and analytical writing.

english_definition: To decide or establish something; to conclude something after consideration.

GMAT_score: Frequently used in critical reasoning and problem-solving contexts.

GMAT_score: Moderately relevant in reading comprehension and critical reasoning

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension section

example_sentence: The diameter of the circle is twice the radius.
korean_translation: 원의 지름은 반지름의 두 배이다.

english_definition: A ruler with total power over a country, typically one who has obtained control by force.
example_sentence: The dictator imposed strict laws to silence any opposition.
korean_translation: 독재자는 어떤 반대도 침묵시키기 위해 엄격한 법을 제정했다.

GMAT_score: Moderate

korean_definition: 말하는 방식 또는 단어 선택과 사용
english_definition: The choice and use of words in speech or writing

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: to recognize or show the difference between two or more things

korean_translation: 사실과 의견을 구별하는 것이 중요하다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for critical reasoning and analytical writing

english_definition: To spread out or distribute over a large area; to scatter

GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily in reading comprehension or logical analysis.

english_definition: to break down food in the stomach; to understand or absorb information; a summary or condensed version

korean_translation: 그녀는 강의에서 나온 복잡한 정보를 이해하는 데 시간이 좀 걸렸다.

english_definition: The state or quality of being worthy of honor or respect.

korean_definition: 어떤 상황에서 선택의 여지가 없는 곤란한 문제 또는 딜레마
english_definition: A situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two or more alternatives, often equally undesirable.

english_definition: Having a low level of brightness or clarity

english_definition: A measurable extent of length, width, height, or scope of something.

english_definition: to make or become smaller, less, or less important

example_sentence: The diminutive puppy was so small that it could fit in the palm of my hand.
korean_translation: 그 작은 강아지는 너무 작아서 내 손바닥에 들어갈 수 있었다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, rarely used in analytical contexts

english_definition: An official document certifying the completion of a course of study or the attainment of a degree.

korean_definition: 국가 간의 외교적 관계를 관리하고 협상하는 기술 또는 활동
english_definition: The art or practice of managing international relations, typically by a country's representatives abroad

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for reading comprehension and critical reasoning sections

english_definition: straightforward, clear, and without deviation

english_definition: An indefinite and very long period of time; an age.

GMAT_score: Low

GMAT_score: Low

example_sentence: The hijacking of the airplane caused a major international crisis.

IELTS_score: 6.5-7.5 (Advanced vocabulary for discussion topics)
GMAT_score: Relevant for reading comprehension and critical reasoning sections

english_definition: to make it difficult for something to happen or progress
example_sentence: Heavy traffic can hinder emergency vehicles from reaching their destinations quickly.
korean_translation: 교통 체증은 긴급 차량이 목적지에 신속히 도달하는 것을 방해할 수 있다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance - commonly used in academic writing and speaking.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance - occasionally appears in reading comprehension or critical reasoning.

english_definition: To accumulate or store something, often excessively
example_sentence: She tends to hoard old magazines in her attic.
korean_translation: 그녀는 다락방에 오래된 잡지를 쌓아두는 경향이 있다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance for vocabulary in writing and speaking sections
GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily useful for reading comprehension

english_definition: Having a space or cavity inside; not solid; empty.
example_sentence: The tree trunk was hollow and filled with insects.
korean_translation: 나무 줄기는 속이 비어 있었고 벌레들로 가득 차 있었다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance, often used in descriptive contexts.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, rarely appears in business-related contexts.

english_definition: A demonstration of respect or honor towards someone or something.
example_sentence: The artist paid homage to her mentor through her latest painting.
korean_translation: 그 예술가는 최근 그림을 통해 멘토에게 경의를 표했다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance, commonly used in academic and formal contexts.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, occasionally appears in reading comprehension passages.

korean_definition: 생물이 환경 변화에도 내부 상태를 일정하게 유지하려는 경향 또는 능력
english_definition: The tendency or ability of an organism to maintain internal stability despite external changes
example_sentence: The human body achieves homeostasis through mechanisms like sweating and shivering.
korean_translation: 인체는 땀을 흘리거나 몸을 떨면서 항상성을 유지한다.
IELTS_score: 6.5 이상에서 자주 사용됨
GMAT_score: 중급에서 고급 지문에 등장 가능

korean_definition: 인류와 그 조상을 포함하는 영장류의 한 분류군
english_definition: A member of the biological family Hominidae, which includes humans and their ancestors.
example_sentence: Scientists discovered a new hominid species in the fossil record.
korean_translation: 과학자들은 화석 기록에서 새로운 호미니드 종을 발견했다.
IELTS_score: Low relevance; primarily used in academic contexts.
GMAT_score: Low relevance; not commonly used in business contexts.

english_definition: Consisting of parts that are all of the same kind or nature.
example_sentence: The population of the small village was remarkably homogeneous.
korean_translation: 작은 마을의 인구는 놀라울 정도로 동질적이었다.

english_definition: Deserving respect and morally upright
example_sentence: She is an honorable person who always acts with integrity.
korean_translation: 그녀는 항상 정직하게 행동하는 존경받을 만한 사람이다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance for vocabulary section
GMAT_score: High relevance for verbal reasoning section

english_definition: The line at which the earth's surface and the sky appear to meet
example_sentence: The sun dipped below the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
korean_translation: 태양이 지평선 아래로 내려가며 하늘을 주황색과 분홍색으로 물들였다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in topics about nature and landscapes
GMAT_score: Low relevance unless used metaphorically in business contexts

english_definition: The art or practice of garden cultivation and management
example_sentence: Horticulture plays a vital role in sustainable agriculture.
korean_translation: 원예는 지속 가능한 농업에서 중요한 역할을 한다.

english_definition: The friendly and generous reception and entertainment of guests, visitors, or strangers.
example_sentence: The staff at the hotel were praised for their exceptional hospitality.
korean_translation: 호텔 직원들은 뛰어난 환대에 대해 칭찬을 받았다.
IELTS_score: Moderately important for topics related to culture and travel.
GMAT_score: Rarely relevant unless discussing business sectors like tourism or service industries.

korean_definition: 인질; 어떤 목적을 이루기 위해 강제로 잡아둔 사람
english_definition: A person who is seized or held as security for the fulfillment of a condition.
example_sentence: The kidnappers held the businessman as a hostage until their demands were met.
korean_translation: 납치범들은 그들의 요구가 충족될 때까지 사업가를 인질로 잡았다.

english_definition: Unfriendly or antagonistic; showing opposition or dislike.
example_sentence: The manager's hostile attitude made the employees uncomfortable.
korean_translation: 관리자의 적대적인 태도는 직원들을 불편하게 만들었다.

english_definition: A color or shade; a particular tone of color.
example_sentence: The sky was painted in hues of orange and pink during the sunset.
korean_translation: 하늘은 석양이 질 때 주황색과 분홍색의 색조로 물들었다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance for color-related topics in writing and speaking.
GMAT_score: Low relevance unless used metaphorically in reading comprehension.

english_definition: The amount of moisture or water vapor present in the air
example_sentence: The humidity in the room made it feel much warmer than it actually was.
korean_translation: 방 안의 습도가 실제 온도보다 더 따뜻하게 느껴지게 만들었다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance in topics related to weather and climate
GMAT_score: Low relevance but may appear in reading passages

korean_definition: 서두르다, 바쁘게 움직이다, 열심히 일하다, 혹은 속임수로 얻다
english_definition: to move or act quickly and energetically, to work hard, or to obtain something by deceit
example_sentence: She had to hustle to catch the last train.
korean_translation: 그녀는 마지막 기차를 잡기 위해 서둘러야 했다.

korean_definition: 두 가지 이상의 요소가 결합된 혼합물 또는 결합체
english_definition: A combination or mixture of two or more different elements or types
example_sentence: The car is a hybrid of electric and gasoline power.
korean_translation: 그 자동차는 전기와 가솔린 동력을 결합한 혼합형이다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance in environmental and technology topics
GMAT_score: Low relevance unless discussing innovation or market strategies

korean_definition: 물질이 물과 반응하여 화학 결합이 끊어지는 과정
english_definition: The chemical process in which a molecule reacts with water and breaks its bonds.
example_sentence: During digestion, enzymes facilitate the hydrolysis of proteins into amino acids.
korean_translation: 소화 과정에서 효소는 단백질을 아미노산으로 분해하는 가수분해를 촉진합니다.
IELTS_score: Moderately relevant for scientific topics
GMAT_score: Minimally relevant unless specific to chemistry contexts

korean_definition: 물을 싫어하거나 잘 섞이지 않는 성질
english_definition: Having a tendency to repel or fail to mix with water
example_sentence: The hydrophobic coating on the fabric prevents it from absorbing water.
korean_translation: 천에 발린 소수성 코팅은 물을 흡수하지 않게 합니다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance in scientific topics
GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily in specialized contexts

korean_definition: 활동이 지나치게 많거나 통제되지 않는 상태
english_definition: Excessive or uncontrollable activity or movement
example_sentence: Children with hyperactivity often struggle to focus in school.
korean_translation: 과잉행동이 있는 아이들은 종종 학교에서 집중하기 어려워합니다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance
GMAT_score: Low relevance

korean_definition: 최면 상태 또는 최면을 거는 행위
english_definition: A state of consciousness in which a person is highly responsive to suggestion or a process of inducing such a state.
example_sentence: The therapist used hypnosis to help the patient overcome their fear of flying.
korean_translation: 치료사는 환자가 비행 공포를 극복하도록 돕기 위해 최면을 사용했다.

korean_definition: 가설, 어떤 현상에 대한 잠정적인 설명 또는 추측
english_definition: A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence as a starting point for further investigation.
example_sentence: The scientist developed a hypothesis to explain the unusual behavior of the particles.
korean_translation: 과학자는 입자의 이상한 행동을 설명하기 위해 가설을 세웠다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in academic writing and speaking tasks.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in problem-solving and analytical writing.

korean_definition: 강한 감정적 반응이나 통제를 잃은 상태, 때로는 집단적으로 발생하는 비이성적 흥분 상태
english_definition: An uncontrollable emotional reaction, often irrational, sometimes occurring collectively in groups.
example_sentence: The crowd erupted in hysteria when the celebrity appeared on stage.
korean_translation: 그 유명인이 무대에 등장하자 군중은 히스테리 상태로 폭발했다.
IELTS_score: Relevant for understanding emotional and psychological vocabulary in reading and writing sections.
GMAT_score: Occasionally relevant in critical reasoning and reading comprehension sections.

english_definition: Conforming to a standard of perfection or excellence; representing an ideal form.
example_sentence: She strives to achieve the ideal balance between work and personal life.
korean_translation: 그녀는 일과 개인 생활의 이상적인 균형을 이루기 위해 노력한다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in describing abstract concepts in writing and speaking tasks.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in analytical writing and critical reasoning sections.

english_definition: exactly the same; alike in every way
example_sentence: The two paintings look identical to each other.
korean_translation: 그 두 그림은 서로 동일해 보인다.
IELTS_score: High relevance, frequently used in reading and writing sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, occasionally used in critical reasoning and analytical writing sections

english_definition: To recognize or establish as being a particular person or thing.
example_sentence: The witness was able to identify the suspect in the lineup.
korean_translation: 증인은 용의자를 대열에서 식별할 수 있었다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for listening and reading sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for critical reasoning and comprehension sections

korean_definition: 일을 하지 않거나 활동하지 않는 상태
english_definition: Not active or in use; without purpose or effect
example_sentence: The workers remained idle during the equipment's downtime.
korean_translation: 기계가 멈춰 있는 동안 노동자들은 활동하지 않고 있었다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance for vocabulary in Listening and Writing sections
GMAT_score: Low relevance, typically not included in critical reasoning or quantitative sections

english_definition: To set something on fire or cause it to start burning; to arouse or inspire.
example_sentence: The spark was enough to ignite the dry wood.
korean_translation: 그 불꽃은 마른 나무에 불을 붙이기에 충분했다.

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: Lacking knowledge, awareness, or education
example_sentence: He was completely ignorant of the rules of the game.
korean_translation: 그는 게임의 규칙에 대해 전혀 알지 못했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance in verbal reasoning

english_definition: to refuse to take notice of or acknowledge; to disregard intentionally
example_sentence: She chose to ignore the negative comments and focused on her work.
korean_translation: 그녀는 부정적인 댓글을 무시하고 자신의 일에 집중하기로 했다.
IELTS_score: Medium
GMAT_score: Medium

english_definition: not clear enough to read
example_sentence: The handwriting on the document was completely illegible.
korean_translation: 문서에 적힌 글씨는 완전히 읽을 수 없었다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance for academic reading comprehension
GMAT_score: Low relevance for verbal reasoning

english_definition: illegal, unauthorized
example_sentence: The authorities discovered the illicit trade of endangered species.
korean_translation: 당국은 멸종 위기 종들의 불법 거래를 발견했다.
IELTS_score: Relevant to reading and writing sections
GMAT_score: Relevant to critical reasoning and analytical writing

english_definition: A false idea or belief, or something that seems to be real but is not.
example_sentence: The magician created an illusion that left the audience in awe.
korean_translation: 마술사는 관중을 놀라게 하는 환상을 만들어냈다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in reading and writing sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in verbal reasoning.

english_definition: to explain or make something clear by using examples or diagrams
example_sentence: The professor used diagrams to illustrate the complex process.
korean_translation: 교수는 복잡한 과정을 설명하기 위해 다이어그램을 사용했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for academic writing and speaking tasks
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for verbal reasoning sections

english_definition: Visually descriptive or figurative language, especially in a literary work.
example_sentence: The author uses vivid imagery to paint a picture of the bustling city.
korean_translation: 저자는 생생한 심상을 사용하여 분주한 도시의 모습을 그려냅니다.

korean_definition: 상상 속에 존재하는, 실제로는 존재하지 않는 것
english_definition: Existing only in the imagination; not real.
example_sentence: She created an imaginary world in her novel.
korean_translation: 그녀는 자신의 소설 속에서 상상 속의 세계를 창조했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in creative writing and descriptive topics.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily used in abstract reasoning sections.

english_definition: having or showing creativity or inventiveness
example_sentence: The artist presented an imaginative interpretation of the story.
korean_translation: 그 예술가는 이야기의 상상력 넘치는 해석을 선보였다.

english_definition: A lack of balance or symmetry; disproportion.
example_sentence: The economic imbalance between rich and poor countries is growing.
korean_translation: 부유한 나라와 가난한 나라 사이의 경제적 불균형이 심화되고 있다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in writing and speaking sections related to social and economic topics.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and critical reasoning sections.

english_definition: to copy the actions, appearance, or behavior of someone or something
example_sentence: Children often imitate their parents' behavior.
korean_translation: 아이들은 종종 부모의 행동을 따라합니다.
IELTS_score: High relevance due to common use in discussions about behavior and learning
GMAT_score: Medium relevance, occasionally used in reading comprehension or analogy questions

english_definition: extremely large or great, especially in scale or degree
example_sentence: The mountain range was so immense that it seemed to stretch endlessly.
korean_translation: 그 산맥은 너무 거대해서 끝없이 뻗어 있는 것처럼 보였다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for vocabulary improvement in writing and speaking sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and analytical writing

english_definition: to involve oneself deeply in an activity or interest; to submerge in liquid
example_sentence: She immersed herself in the study of ancient cultures.
korean_translation: 그녀는 고대 문화 연구에 몰두했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for describing focused activities or processes.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for comprehension and reading sections.

english_definition: A person who comes to live permanently in a foreign country.
example_sentence: The government provides support programs for immigrant families.
korean_translation: 정부는 이민자 가족을 위한 지원 프로그램을 제공합니다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in topics related to migration and global issues.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in context of cultural and economic discussions.

english_definition: About to happen; impending.
example_sentence: The storm's arrival was imminent.
korean_translation: 폭풍의 도착이 임박했다.
IELTS_score: Moderate
GMAT_score: Moderate

english_definition: not conforming to accepted standards of morality
example_sentence: Cheating on the exam is considered immoral behavior.
korean_translation: 시험에서 부정행위를 하는 것은 부도덕한 행동으로 간주된다.

english_definition: Living forever; not subject to death.
example_sentence: The gods in ancient mythology were considered immortal.
korean_translation: 고대 신화 속 신들은 죽지 않는 존재로 여겨졌다.

english_definition: Resistant to a particular infection or toxin; not affected by something.
example_sentence: The vaccine made her immune to the disease.
korean_translation: 백신은 그녀를 그 질병에 면역되게 만들었다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in topics related to health and medicine.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, but may appear in scientific or analytical contexts.

korean_definition: 손상 또는 장애를 의미하며, 일반적으로 신체적, 정신적 기능이 저하된 상태를 나타냄
english_definition: The state or condition of being diminished, damaged, or weakened in function or ability
example_sentence: The impairment of his hearing made communication difficult.
korean_translation: 그의 청력 손상은 의사소통을 어렵게 만들었다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for topics related to health or disabilities
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for passages discussing business losses or operational challenges

english_definition: Not biased; treating all sides equally and fairly.
example_sentence: A good judge must remain impartial during the trial.
korean_translation: 좋은 판사는 재판 중에 공정함을 유지해야 한다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in writing and speaking tasks discussing fairness or justice.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and critical reasoning sections.

english_definition: To accuse a public official of misconduct or to challenge their integrity.
example_sentence: The parliament moved to impeach the president for corruption charges.
korean_translation: 의회는 대통령을 부패 혐의로 탄핵하려고 움직였다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance (Legal and Political contexts)
GMAT_score: Low relevance (Rarely used in business contexts)

english_definition: to slow down or prevent progress or movement
example_sentence: Heavy traffic can impede the arrival of emergency services.
korean_translation: 교통 체증은 응급 서비스의 도착을 방해할 수 있다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance for academic writing and speaking
GMAT_score: High relevance in critical reasoning and comprehension

english_definition: extremely necessary or urgent; giving an authoritative command
example_sentence: It is imperative that we address climate change immediately.
korean_translation: 기후 변화에 즉각적으로 대응하는 것이 반드시 필요합니다.
IELTS_score: High relevance due to usage in formal writing and speaking tasks
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in analytical writing and critical reasoning sections

korean_definition: 한 국가가 다른 국가를 정치적, 경제적 또는 군사적으로 지배하려는 정책이나 행동.
english_definition: A policy or practice by which a country extends its power and influence over other countries through political, economic, or military means.
example_sentence: The history of imperialism often shows the exploitation of weaker nations by stronger ones.
korean_translation: 제국주의의 역사는 종종 강대국이 약소국을 착취한 사례를 보여준다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in writing and reading sections, especially in topics related to history and global issues.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, often appears in reading comprehension passages discussing global economics or history.

english_definition: to put something or someone in danger
example_sentence: Failure to address the issue could imperil the entire project.
korean_translation: 문제를 해결하지 못하면 전체 프로젝트가 위험에 처할 수 있습니다.
IELTS_score: Moderately relevant for vocabulary in Writing and Speaking sections.
GMAT_score: Relevant for critical reasoning and reading comprehension.

english_definition: not allowing liquid or gas to pass through
example_sentence: The jacket is made of an impermeable material to keep you dry in the rain.
korean_translation: 그 재킷은 비를 맞아도 젖지 않도록 액체가 통과하지 않는 소재로 만들어졌습니다.

english_definition: not allowing something (such as water or light) to pass through; not affected or influenced by something
example_sentence: The new coat is impervious to rain and wind.
korean_translation: 그 새 코트는 비와 바람을 통과시키지 않는다.

english_definition: A force or influence that makes something happen or develop more quickly.
example_sentence: The new policy provided fresh impetus for economic growth.
korean_translation: 새로운 정책은 경제 성장을 위한 신선한 추진력을 제공했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for vocabulary in writing and speaking sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing and verbal reasoning.

korean_definition: 심다, 이식하다; 어떤 것을 인공적으로 몸에 삽입하거나 심는 행위
english_definition: To insert or fix something (such as a device or tissue) into a person's body or an object artificially.
example_sentence: The surgeon decided to implant a pacemaker to regulate the patient's heartbeat.
korean_translation: 외과 의사가 환자의 심장 박동을 조절하기 위해 심박 조율기를 이식하기로 결정했다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance
GMAT_score: Low relevance

english_definition: Not seeming reasonable or probable; unlikely to be true.
example_sentence: It seemed implausible that he could finish the project in just one week.
korean_translation: 그가 단 일주일 만에 프로젝트를 끝낼 수 있다는 것은 믿기 어려워 보였다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance for vocabulary section
GMAT_score: High relevance for critical reasoning and reading comprehension

english_definition: To put into effect or carry out; a tool or instrument
example_sentence: The company decided to implement a new strategy to increase sales.
korean_translation: 회사는 매출을 증가시키기 위해 새로운 전략을 실행하기로 결정했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in Writing and Speaking tasks
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in Reading Comprehension

english_definition: to suggest or indicate something indirectly without explicitly stating it
example_sentence: Her tone of voice seemed to imply that she was not happy with the decision.
korean_translation: 그녀의 말투는 그녀가 그 결정에 만족하지 않는다는 것을 암시하는 듯했다.
GMAT_score: High relevance in verbal reasoning and reading comprehension

english_definition: To bring goods or services into a country from abroad for sale.
example_sentence: Many countries import oil to meet their energy needs.
korean_translation: 많은 나라들이 에너지 필요를 충족하기 위해 석유를 수입한다.

english_definition: To force someone to accept something or to put a burden on someone or something.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, useful for reading comprehension and argument analysis sections.

english_definition: Evoking admiration or respect; strikingly remarkable.
example_sentence: The artist's work was truly impressive and left the audience in awe.

IELTS_score: High relevance for vocabulary section, especially for describing impactful events or achievements.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for essay writing and verbal reasoning.

korean_definition: 어떤 흔적이나 자국을 남기다; 마음에 깊이 새기다

example_sentence: The teacher's words left a deep imprint on her mind.

korean_definition: 위에, ~에 대해, 진행 중인 상태를 나타내는 단어
english_definition: Indicating position (physically or abstractly), ongoing action, or about something.
example_sentence: The book is on the table.
korean_translation: 그 책은 테이블 위에 있다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for logical reasoning and sentence correction

english_definition: to put someone in prison or to confine them
example_sentence: The government decided to imprison the activists for their protests.
korean_translation: 정부는 시위 활동가들을 감금하기로 결정했다.

english_definition: To create or perform something spontaneously without preparation
example_sentence: The actor had to improvise when he forgot his lines.
korean_translation: 그 배우는 대사를 잊었을 때 즉흥적으로 연기를 해야 했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for speaking and writing tasks
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing

english_definition: Acting or done without forethought; driven by sudden urges or emotions.
example_sentence: She made an impulsive decision to quit her job and travel the world.
korean_translation: 그녀는 충동적으로 직장을 그만두고 세계 여행을 하기로 결정했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, may appear in Reading comprehension.

english_definition: to begin officially or formally; to install in office
example_sentence: The new president was inaugurated in a grand ceremony.
korean_translation: 새 대통령은 성대한 행사에서 취임했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance; used occasionally in analytical writing.

korean_definition: 어떤 행동을 자극하거나 동기를 부여하는 자극 또는 이유
english_definition: A thing that motivates or encourages someone to do something
example_sentence: The company offered financial incentives to its employees to boost productivity.
korean_translation: 회사는 생산성을 높이기 위해 직원들에게 금전적 인센티브를 제공했다.

GMAT_score: High relevance in logical reasoning and business case studies

korean_definition: 사건, 특히 예상하지 못한 일이나 사고
english_definition: An event, especially one that is unexpected or unusual
example_sentence: The police are investigating the incident that occurred last night.
korean_translation: 경찰은 어젯밤에 발생한 사건을 조사하고 있다.

english_definition: To burn something completely until it is reduced to ashes
example_sentence: The company decided to incinerate the confidential documents to ensure security.
korean_translation: 회사는 보안을 위해 기밀 문서를 소각하기로 결정했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance in business context

english_definition: A surgical cut made in skin or flesh.
example_sentence: The surgeon made a precise incision to remove the tumor.
korean_translation: 외과 의사가 종양을 제거하기 위해 정밀한 절개를 했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance unless used in specific scenarios.

english_definition: Remarkably clear and direct; sharp and analytical in thought or expression.

korean_translation: 그녀의 날카로운 발언은 회의 중 복잡한 문제를 명확히 했다.

english_definition: To provoke or encourage someone to take action, especially negative or violent action.
example_sentence: The leader's speech was designed to incite violence among the crowd.

GMAT_score: Low relevance for GMAT verbal reasoning.

korean_definition: 궂은, 혹독한 (특히 날씨가 좋지 않은 상태를 묘사할 때 사용)
english_definition: Unpleasantly cold, wet, or stormy, typically referring to weather.
example_sentence: The hikers decided to postpone their trip due to the inclement weather.
korean_translation: 등산객들은 궂은 날씨 때문에 여행을 연기하기로 결정했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance (rarely used in business contexts)

english_definition: having a tendency or preference towards something; slanted or tilted

korean_translation: 그녀는 그의 의견에 동의하는 경향이 있다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and critical reasoning

english_definition: Impossible to imagine or believe; beyond comprehension.

IELTS_score: High relevance in expressing abstract ideas or opinions.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in challenging assumptions or critical reasoning.

english_definition: To include or combine something as part of a whole.
example_sentence: The company decided to incorporate new technologies into their workflow.
korean_translation: 그 회사는 새로운 기술을 업무 흐름에 통합하기로 결정했다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for critical reasoning and reading comprehension.

english_definition: impossible to believe; extraordinary

korean_translation: 산 정상에서 본 경치는 정말 대단했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for descriptive essays or speaking tasks.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and analytical writing.

english_definition: To keep something at a suitable temperature so that it develops, especially eggs or bacteria.
example_sentence: The scientist used a special machine to incubate the cells.
korean_translation: 과학자는 세포를 배양하기 위해 특수 기계를 사용했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance in business contexts

english_definition: Currently holding a particular position or role; imposed as a duty or obligation

IELTS_score: Medium relevance in writing and speaking sections
GMAT_score: High relevance in reading comprehension and critical reasoning sections

english_definition: persisting tirelessly; incapable of being fatigued
example_sentence: Her indefatigable efforts to improve the community were highly admired.
korean_translation: 그녀의 지역 사회를 개선하려는 지치지 않는 노력은 매우 존경받았다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for reading comprehension and analytical writing tasks.

english_definition: expressing the situation of something that is enclosed or surrounded by something else

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance, typically appears in analytical writing or comprehension

korean_translation: 그 결과는 성과에서 상당한 개선을 나타낸다.

english_definition: originating or occurring naturally in a particular place; native

GMAT_score: Low relevance, might appear in Reading Comprehension

english_definition: absolutely necessary or essential

english_definition: to cause something to happen or persuade someone to do something

korean_translation: 과학자는 실험실에서 화학 반응을 유도하는 데 성공했다.

korean_translation: 그녀는 초콜릿 케이크 한 조각을 즐기기로 결심했다.

english_definition: The resistance of any physical object to any change in its state of motion or rest.
example_sentence: The spacecraft continued to drift in space due to its inertia.

GMAT_score: 고급 문제에서 물리적 개념으로 출제 가능

GMAT_score: Critical reasoning 및 논리적 글쓰기에서 유용

GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: limitless or endless in extent, size, or quantity

english_definition: The basic physical and organizational structures needed for the operation of a society or enterprise.

english_definition: clever, original, or inventive in design or execution

english_definition: Existing as a natural or essential part of something.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for verbal and analytical writing sections

korean_definition: 새로운 계획이나 행동을 시작하는 능력 또는 결단력
english_definition: The ability or willingness to take the first step in starting something new or leading action.
example_sentence: She took the initiative to organize the team meeting.
korean_translation: 그녀는 팀 회의를 조직하는 주도권을 잡았다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for Analytical Writing section

english_definition: To force a substance into something, usually a liquid into the body or an object.
example_sentence: The doctor decided to inject the patient with antibiotics.
korean_translation: 의사는 환자에게 항생제를 주사하기로 결정했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily used in specific contexts.

korean_definition: 부상, 신체나 정신에 해를 입은 상태
english_definition: Harm or damage to the body or mind

english_definition: Existing naturally or inherently; inborn.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing and verbal reasoning sections.

english_definition: Not harmful or offensive

korean_translation: 그 댓글은 해가 없었지만 여전히 논란을 일으켰다.

korean_definition: 혁신, 새로운 아이디어를 창출하거나 기존의 방식을 개선하는 것
english_definition: The act of introducing new ideas, methods, or products.
example_sentence: The company's innovation in renewable energy has made a significant impact.
korean_translation: 그 회사의 재생 가능 에너지 혁신은 큰 영향을 미쳤다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for Analytical Writing and Critical Thinking sections.

english_definition: too many to be counted; countless

korean_definition: 유기물이 아닌, 생명체에서 유래하지 않은 것을 의미함.
english_definition: Not consisting of or deriving from living matter; non-organic.
example_sentence: The laboratory specializes in the study of inorganic compounds.
korean_translation: 그 실험실은 무기화합물 연구를 전문으로 합니다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance for scientific or technical vocabulary.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, except in specialized contexts.

english_definition: An act of seeking information, investigation, or asking a question.
example_sentence: The detective started an inquiry into the missing person's case.
korean_translation: 탐정은 실종자 사건에 대한 조사를 시작했습니다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for academic writing and speaking sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing and reading comprehension.

english_definition: To write or carve words or symbols onto a surface
example_sentence: The artist decided to inscribe his name on the sculpture.
korean_translation: 예술가는 조각품에 자신의 이름을 새기기로 결정했다.

korean_definition: 통찰력, 사물이나 상황에 대해 깊이 이해하는 능력
english_definition: The ability to gain a deep understanding of a person, situation, or concept
example_sentence: Her insight into human behavior is truly remarkable.
korean_translation: 그녀의 인간 행동에 대한 통찰력은 정말 놀랍습니다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing

english_definition: showing a rude and arrogant lack of respect
example_sentence: The insolent child refused to listen to his teacher.

GMAT_score: Low relevance for verbal section

english_definition: to look at something carefully in order to learn more about it or find any flaws
example_sentence: The mechanic will inspect the car for any issues.

GMAT_score: medium

english_definition: To fill someone with the urge or ability to do or feel something, especially something creative.
example_sentence: The teacher's enthusiasm inspired the students to work harder.
korean_translation: 선생님의 열정은 학생들에게 더 열심히 노력하도록 영감을 주었다.

GMAT_score: Medium

korean_definition: 설치하다, 장비를 특정 장소에 배치하거나 설정하다

GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily used in problem-solving scenarios

english_definition: Occurring or done in an instant or immediately.
example_sentence: The reaction was almost instantaneous.
korean_translation: 그 반응은 거의 즉각적이었다.

english_definition: to provoke or incite someone to take action
example_sentence: The teacher warned the students not to instigate fights during recess.
korean_translation: 선생님은 학생들에게 쉬는 시간에 싸움을 유도하지 말라고 경고했다.
IELTS_score: Moderate relevance for vocabulary section
GMAT_score: High relevance for analytical writing and verbal section

english_definition: to gradually impart or infuse an idea, feeling, or attitude
example_sentence: Parents often try to instill moral values in their children.
korean_translation: 부모는 종종 자녀에게 도덕적 가치를 주입하려고 한다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for writing and speaking sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing

english_definition: A natural or innate impulse, inclination, or tendency.
example_sentence: Her instinct told her that something was wrong.
korean_translation: 그녀의 본능은 무언가 잘못되었다고 말했다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in critical reasoning and reading comprehension sections.

korean_definition: 조직이나 시설, 특히 공공 기관 또는 단체
english_definition: An organization or establishment dedicated to a specific purpose, especially public or educational.
example_sentence: The university is a prestigious institution known for its research excellence.
korean_translation: 그 대학교는 연구 우수성으로 유명한 명문 기관이다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and essay sections

korean_definition: 단열, 절연 (열이나 전기가 전달되지 않도록 막는 것)

example_sentence: Proper insulation can significantly reduce energy costs.
korean_translation: 적절한 단열은 에너지 비용을 크게 줄일 수 있다.
IELTS_score: Medium relevance in topics related to environment and energy.
GMAT_score: Low relevance, but may appear in reading comprehension or business contexts.

korean_definition: 보험, 위험 또는 손실에 대비하여 보장하는 계약
english_definition: A contract or policy that provides financial protection against loss or risk.
example_sentence: Having health insurance can save you from unexpected medical expenses.

IELTS_score: High relevance for vocabulary in writing and speaking sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for reading comprehension and business context.

english_definition: Not damaged or impaired; in its original state.
example_sentence: The artifact was found intact after being buried for centuries.
korean_translation: 그 유물은 수세기 동안 묻혀 있었음에도 불구하고 손상되지 않은 상태로 발견되었다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for vocabulary in reading and writing sections.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for reading comprehension and critical reasoning sections.

english_definition: The act of taking something in, especially air, food, or liquid
example_sentence: The patient's daily intake of calories was closely monitored.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, rarely used in the context of business or logic problems

korean_definition: 필수적인, 없어서는 안 될; 전체의, 통합된
english_definition: essential, necessary for completeness; combined or unified
example_sentence: A healthy diet is integral to overall well-being.

english_definition: to combine or bring together to form a whole

korean_translation: 새로운 정책은 지역 사회 내 서로 다른 문화 집단을 통합하는 것을 목표로 한다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for academic and social topics
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for business context and logical reasoning

korean_definition: 정직, 성실, 도덕적 원칙을 준수하는 상태
english_definition: The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles
example_sentence: She is respected for her integrity and dedication to her work.
korean_translation: 그녀는 정직함과 일에 대한 헌신으로 존경받는다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for writing and speaking sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for analytical writing assessment

korean_definition: 지적인, 지적 능력을 가진 사람 또는 지적 활동과 관련된
english_definition: Relating to the intellect or an intelligent person
example_sentence: She is admired for her intellectual achievements.
korean_translation: 그녀는 그녀의 지적 성취로 존경받는다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in reading and writing sections
GMAT_score: Relevant in verbal reasoning and analytical writing

english_definition: a determination to do something; a purpose or goal
example_sentence: Her intent was clear from the beginning.
korean_translation: 그녀의 의도는 처음부터 명확했다.

english_definition: to act in a way that has an effect on another; to communicate or work together
example_sentence: People from different cultures often interact in global business settings.
korean_translation: 다양한 문화의 사람들이 글로벌 비즈니스 환경에서 종종 상호 작용한다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in speaking and writing sections for communication topics
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension and critical reasoning sections

english_definition: to involve oneself in a situation when it is not wanted or needed, often causing disruption

GMAT_score: Occasionally appears in Reading Comprehension or Critical Reasoning sections.

english_definition: a short break or pause, especially during a performance or event

korean_translation: 연극 두 막 사이에 15분간의 휴식 시간이 있었다.

english_definition: occurring at irregular intervals; not continuous or steady
example_sentence: The internet connection was intermittent throughout the day.
korean_translation: 인터넷 연결이 하루 종일 간헐적이었다.
IELTS_score: High relevance in listening and reading sections for describing irregular patterns.
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance in reading comprehension for business scenarios.

english_definition: situated on the inside; inner; relating to the inner workings or affairs
example_sentence: The company focused on improving its internal processes.
korean_translation: 그 회사는 내부 프로세스를 개선하는 데 집중했다.

english_definition: to explain the meaning of something, to understand something in a particular way, or to translate spoken or written words into another language
example_sentence: She tried to interpret the ancient manuscript.
korean_translation: 그녀는 고대 원고를 해석하려고 노력했다.
IELTS_score: High relevance for reading and writing sections
GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for verbal reasoning

english_definition: to cross or meet at a point

korean_translation: 두 도로는 공원 근처에서 교차한다.

english_definition: to twist or weave together; to become closely connected or involved
example_sentence: The vines intertwine with each other, creating a dense canopy.
korean_translation: 덩굴들이 서로 얽혀 밀집된 덮개를 형성한다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance for verbal reasoning and analytical writing

english_definition: The act of intervening or interfering in a situation, especially to prevent or alter the outcome.

english_definition: To frighten or threaten someone into doing something
example_sentence: The bully tried to intimidate the smaller kids in the schoolyard.
korean_translation: 그 깡패는 학교 운동장에서 작은 아이들을 겁주려고 했다.

GMAT_score: Low relevance, primarily in reading comprehension

english_definition: Administering a substance directly into a vein.
example_sentence: The medication was delivered intravenously to ensure rapid absorption.
korean_translation: 그 약물은 빠른 흡수를 위해 정맥으로 전달되었습니다.
IELTS_score: low
GMAT_score: low

english_definition: fearless and adventurous
example_sentence: The intrepid explorer ventured into the unknown jungle.
korean_translation: 그 대담한 탐험가는 미지의 정글로 들어갔다.

english_definition: Very complicated or detailed, having many interrelated parts.
example_sentence: The intricate design of the ancient tapestry amazed everyone.
korean_translation: 고대 태피스트리의 복잡한 디자인은 모든 사람을 놀라게 했다.

GMAT_score: Moderate relevance for verbal reasoning and reading comprehension.

korean_definition: 내향적인 사람, 자기 내부 세계에 집중하는 사람
english_definition: A person who tends to focus on their inner thoughts and feelings rather than seeking external stimulation
example_sentence: Being an introvert, she preferred spending the weekend reading books rather than attending parties.
korean_translation: 내향적인 사람으로서 그녀는 파티에 참석하기보다는 책을 읽으며 주말을 보내는 것을 선호했다.
IELTS_score: Moderate
GMAT_score: Low

english_definition: To overwhelm or flood someone or something with things or people to deal with.
example_sentence: The customer service team was inundated with complaints after the product launch.
korean_translation: 고객 서비스 팀은 제품 출시 후 불만으로 넘쳐났다.
IELTS_score: Moderate
GMAT_score: High

korean_definition: 화합, 조화, 일치 또는 여러 사람이 동시에 같은 행동을 하는 것
english_definition: Complete agreement or harmony; simultaneous performance or utterance of action or sound.
example_sentence: The choir sang in perfect unison during the performance.
